title: Thirteen clubs punished for match-fixing in China
summary: Nine teams will start the upcoming Chinese Super League season on minus points after clubs were sanctioned following an investigation.

title: Aberdeen sign 'physical and robust' Aremu
summary: Aberdeen sign Nigeria defensive midfielder Afeez Aremu from German side Kaiserslautern.

summary: John Mitchell will continue as Red Roses head coach through to the next Women's Rugby World Cup in 2029 and Emily Scarratt joins the coaching staff.

title: Assefa targets London repeat & Sawe eyes course record
summary: Reigning champions Tigst Assefa and Sebastian Sawe will target record-breaking London Marathon victories in April.

title: Honda vehicles used to proactively report road safety issues in nation-first pilot
summary: Honda and DriveOhio have teamed up on a new road safety initiative in which Honda vehicles are being used to collect real-time data that can advise about potential issues and road deficiencies before they become a problem. summary: Hearts confirm a loan deal until the end of the season for Vardar forward Rogers Mato, who will join the club permanently in the summer.

title: 'Big blow' for Bradley to miss play-off - O'Neill
summary: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says it "would certainly be nice" for the injured Conor Bradley to still be a part of the squad for their 2026 World Cup play-offs against Italy in March.

title: Barry goal rescues draw for Everton against Leeds
summary: Watch Premier League highlights as Everton's Thierno Barry continues his good run of form with a second-half goal to earn the Toffees a 1-1 draw with Leeds United.

title: Review: CalDigit TS5 â€“ the best Thunderbolt 5 dock for most Mac users [Video]
summary: After CalDigit TS5, which only sports 15 ports. Although not as powerful as the TS5 Plus, after trying the regular TS5 for the last month, Iâ€™d recommend it over its bigger brother for most Mac users. Like the TS5 Plus, it provides 64 GB/s max PCIe bandwidth, up to 140W of Power Delivery, and a heapâ€¦

title: Seahawks see off Rams in thriller to reach Super Bowl
summary: The Seattle Seahawks beat the Los Angeles Rams 31-27 in a thrilling NFC Championship match to set up a rerun of the 2015 Super Bowl against the New England Patriots.

title: Cal-fouri, a lesser-spotted law & Russell v the Shed - Prem talking points
summary: Noah Caluori's teenage kicks continue as Finn Russell asks for quiet and Tommy Freeman and Henry Pollock benefit from an obscure corner of the law book.

title: The electrification of everything: Best ideas of the century
summary: Transitioning from fossil fuels to renewable power is crucial. The opening of Tesla's first "gigafactory", which used economies of scale to electrify our transport and energy systems, marked a turning point in this endeavour

title: Rejections, depression & promise to his mum - Thiago's route to top
summary: Igor Thiago's route to the Premier League has been far from straightforward - BBC Sport charts the rise of Brentford's record-breaking Brazilian striker.

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
summary: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.
